_description: Precepts concluding, ‘Be man noȝt hors noþer asse’ — five monorhyming lines of varying length

BodLauMis656.Transcription:
Ete drynke slepe lasseWake wepe bide fasteloue masselete
                    lustes assebe man noȝt hors noþer asse
BodLauMis656.Editions:
Coxe,  Henry Octavius. 
             Catalogus Codices Laudiani.
         Oxon: e Typographeo academico, 1858: 1.
Skeat,  Walter William,
                        ed.  
             William Langland: The Vision of Piers Plowman.
            Vol. 3: Text C.
             EETS
         o.s. 54 (1873); repr. 1978: xxvii.
Kölbing,  Eugen,  and  M. Day, eds.  
             The Siege of Jerusalem, from Bodleian MS. Laud Misc. 656.
EETS
         o.s. 188 (1932); repr. 1988: vii.

CamPeter104.Transcription:
Ete drynke slepe lasseWepe wake byd fastLoue masseLete
                    lustus passebe man neþer hors neþer asse
CamPeter104.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Peterhouse
                College, Cambridge.
         Cambridge: at the UP, 1899: 121.
